That is spelled pitolisant, bud. We know about H1 and H2 blockers, but this H3 CNS stuff is new to most. And WAKIX is all caps, btw.

The medication is titrated over three weeks however it may take up to eight weeks to see results of this medication. Wakix is not safe for everyone and can interact with several medications. Talk with your healthcare provider if you have questions about this medication. ⁣
People with EDS often feel tired during the day and have trouble staying focused and awake even if they got a full nights rest. Wakix is available in tablets and is taken once a day after waking up.

Me too when I first saw it but knowing the patient and seeing the brand name Wakix were decent clues.

So basically, my mast cells dumping histamine erratically into my hypothalamus over the course of years destroyed my circadian rhythm. There's a narcolepsy drug approved for use in the EU / UK called Wakix (generic name is pitolisant).

Part of the reason I began thinking about all of this is that a new narcolepsy drug called pitolisant (or Wakix) was recently approved in the UK and EU - and it blocks the H3 receptor on those hypothalamic neurons.
